text: Acleris lacordairana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Italy, Hungary, Poland, Estonia, Latvia and Russia.Fauna Europaea In the east, the range extends to Japan.Japanese Moths The wingspan is 16–18 mm. Adults are on wing from June to September. The larvae feed on UlmusCheck List of the Tribe Tortricini (Lepidoptera: Tortricidae) in Northeast china, with Two Newly Recorded Species from China and Salix species. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1836 lacordairana Category:Moths of Asia Category:Moths of Europe
title: Acleris lacordairana
